org.eclipselabs.eunit.junit.utils

Class ServiceLocator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
      • org.eclipselabs.eunit.junit.utils.ServiceLocator<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.junit.rules.TestRule
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ServiceConfigurator

    public class ServiceLocator<T>
extends org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
    This class is intended to be used as a JUnit @Rule. It will create a service tracker for the specified service and wait for the service up to the specified timeout. Usage example: 

     @Rule
 public ServiceLocator<TestService> serviceLocator = new ServiceLocator<TestService>(TestService.class);
 
 @Test
 public void myTest()
 {
        TestService service = serviceLocator.getService();
 }
    Author:
    bhunt

      ServiceLocator(java.lang.Class<T> type, long timeout, java.lang.String filter) 
      ServiceLocator(java.lang.Class<T> type, java.lang.String filter)
      Defaults the timeout to 100 ms.
